trans-unit.source: Groups other <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Inline"></xref> flow content elements.
<xref:System.Windows.Documents.Span> is used to group other inline flow content elements together.
No inherent rendering is applied to content or other elements within a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Span> element.
<xref:System.Windows.Documents.Span> enforces a strong content model for child content.
Child elements contained in a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Span> element must be derived from <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Inline>.
Valid child elements include:
Initializes a new, empty instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Span"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Span"></xref> class with the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Inline"></xref> object as the initial contents.
The initial contents of the new <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Span"></xref>.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Span"></xref> class, taking a specified <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Inline"></xref> object as the initial contents of the new <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Span"></xref>, and a <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.TextPointer"></xref> that specifies an insertion position for the new <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Inline"></xref> element.
An <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Inline"></xref> object that specifies the initial contents of the new <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Span"></xref>.
This parameter may be null, in which case no <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Inline"></xref> is inserted.

A <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.TextPointer"></xref> that specifies the position at which to insert the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Span"></xref> element after it is created, or null for no automatic insertion.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Span"></xref> class, taking two <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.TextPointer"></xref> objects that indicate the beginning and end of a selection of content that the new <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Span"></xref> will contain.
This constructor is intended to initialize a new <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Span> element such that it encloses a selection of pre-existing content.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.TextPointer"></xref> that indicates the beginning of a selection of content that the new <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Span"></xref> will contain.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.TextPointer"></xref> that indicates the end of a selection of content that the new <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Span"></xref> will contain.
Raised when start or end is null.
Raised when start and end do not resolve to a range of content suitable for enclosure by a element; for example, if start and end indicate positions in different paragraphs.

Gets an <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.InlineCollection"></xref> containing the top-level <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Inline"></xref> elements that comprise the contents of the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Span"></xref>.
Use the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.InlineCollection> returned by this property to enumerate or manipulate the contents of a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Span> element.

An <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.InlineCollection"></xref> containing the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Inline"></xref> elements that comprise the contents of the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Span"></xref>.
This property has no default value.

Returns a value that indicates whether the content of a <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Span"></xref> element should be serialized during serialization of a <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Run"></xref> object.
This `ShouldSerialize` method is provided because the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Span.Inlines%2A> property does not have a simple default value.
This method indicates whether the property has changed from its default value.

You typically invoke this method if you are either developing a designer for the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Span> or developing your own control incorporating the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Span>.
A serialization service manager object for this object.
`true` if the content should be serialized; otherwise, `false`.
manager is null.
